attributes.action: Parents who pay full fees for their child to be privatly educated, should not have to pay taxes for other children to be educated by the state.
attributes.additional_details: Many parents in the UK make a big investment for their child/children to be privatly educated. Many families make it a priority for their child to have a private education, and as a result, make many cut-backs. For example, some may never go on holiday, so that their children have the best start in life. Why then, should these parents pay, as well as their own child / children to be educated, for another child to be educated under the state?
